paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the TTR gene associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP), including penetrance data and individual patient information.

patients.phenotype: Various clinical manifestations, either presymptomatic or with early and late onset of disease

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The selected FAP patients show various clinical manifestations, either presymptomatic or with early and late onset of disease.

functional_data.summary: The TTR variant was retained in reprogrammed iPSCs and showed high expression of pluripotency markers.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The ATTRV30M variant is the most frequent TTR variant worldwide.
key_quotes: The selected FAP patients show various clinical manifestations, either presymptomatic or with early and late onset of disease.
Two of the five FAP patients express ATTRV30M which represents the most frequent TTR variant worldwide.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variants and penetrance were successfully extracted.
